display_asset.caption: A computer image of the research vessel, which is still being designed and is scheduled to set sail in 2019.

summaries.body: R.R.S. Boaty McBoatface is the front-runner in a British agency's proposal to let the Internet name a research ship. It is the latest case of web users having fun with public polls.

display_asset.caption: A polio vaccine was tested at a government lab in Kunming, China, last year. Over a dozen suspect products have been identified, including vaccines for rabies, polio, meningitis, hepatitis B and mumps, officials in the Chinese province of Shandong said.

summaries.body: The police in China said they have uncovered a criminal ring suspected of selling improperly stored vaccines in dozens of provinces.
North Korea launched several short-range projectiles off its east coast, the South Korean military said. The projectiles flew about 125 miles before landing in the sea.

display_asset.credit: Nancy Borowick for The New York Times

summaries.body: As New York City sets new recycling goals, it is cracking down on scavengers who pick metals, cardboard and plastic from the trash for money.
"Work." "Sorry." "Hello." A researcher has a few theories about why a growing number of hit songs have one-word titles.

display_asset.caption: The Shukhov Tower.

summaries.body: The Shukhov Tower in Moscow, a landmark from the '20s, has been put on a list of endangered global cultural heritage sites.

display_asset.caption: Julia Child’s show “The French Chef” was shown in a four-day marathon on the video-streaming site Twitch.

summaries.body: Known for broadcasting video games, Twitch instead streamed a Julia Child marathon. “This stage is difficult, but Julia is executing this perfectly, top level player,” one user wrote.
Hikers found what police officials said was a “very old” human skull near the Hollywood sign on Saturday.

display_asset.caption: Months after the revamped product hit shelves, Kraft’s ads have tag lines like, “We’d invite you to try it, but you already have.”

summaries.body: In December, Kraft quietly reformulated its macaroni and cheese to remove artificial dyes and preservatives. Fifty million sales later, Kraft will start advertising the change.

display_asset.caption: For women, tops would keep a bit of décolletage and fabrics would be washable.

summaries.body: What if you had to look perfect in black tie every night? Gabi Asfour set out to design suitable uniforms for the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra.

display_asset.caption: Martin Blackwell

summaries.body: A young gay man in Georgia said he was still recovering from burns received when his mother's partner poured scalding water on him and his boyfriend while they slept.
How much do you think Disney will make from "Star Wars: The Force Awakens"? Studios are famously quiet on such details, but one media analyst has an estimate.

display_asset.caption: Bishop Curry singing at a service this month at St. Augustine’s Church in Camden, N.J.
display_asset.credit: Mark Makela for The New York Times

summaries.body: In an interview, Michael B. Curry, the first black leader of the Episcopal Church, said he sees a connection between bigotry that blacks faced and opposition to gay marriage.
Twitter is keeping its 140-character limit despite recent speculation. "It's a good constraint for us," the company's C.E.O. told NBC. "It allows for of-the-moment brevity."

display_asset.caption: Gen. Lori J. Robinson, in Singapore in February, has been selected to lead all military forces in North America.

summaries.body: The White House will nominate Gen. Lori J. Robinson of the Air Force to lead all military forces in North America, and if confirmed, she would be the first woman to head a United States combatant command.

display_asset.caption: Cross Lake, Manitoba, which includes about 6,000 people, has confronted a suicide crisis in recent months.

summaries.body: In the small Cree Indian town of Cross Lake, Manitoba, a rash of suicides and reports of suicidal thoughts have officials seeking national help for a public health crisis.

display_asset.caption: Marie Claire Miskell of New York and Ethan Carlson of Topeka, Kan., in Lower Manhattan during a spell of warm weather this month.

summaries.body: The first day of spring may bring a little surprise to the East Coast on Sunday: a storm that could drop up to four to five inches of snow in some places.

display_asset.caption: An eaglet has finally emerged from its shell. It is one of two eggs in the eagle’s nest watched by the live American Eagle Foundation webcam.

summaries.body: The eagle has hatched. The first of two eaglets at the National Arboretum in Washington has broken through its shell, and a webcam captured it live.

display_asset.caption: A 24-year-old Chinese student who did not want her full name to be used holding up a piece of paper to show the slimness of her waist.

summaries.body: Women and a few men in China are boasting about their thinness by posting photographs of their waists hidden behind a piece of A4 paper.

display_asset.caption: Towers belonging to the Abengoa solar plant in Sanlúcar la Mayor, Spain.

summaries.body: The solar company Abengoa's global ambitions are now the source of its troubles as it tries to avoid what would be the largest bankruptcy in Spanish corporate history.

display_asset.caption: Anthony White was accused of fatally stabbing Mr. Black.

summaries.body: Anthony White, who was suspected of killing his roommate at a Harlem shelter, has been found dead, the police said, ending a citywide manhunt.
Standing desks have been hailed for their health benefits, but a new analysis found little evidence that they help burn calories or reverse the effects of sitting.

display_asset.caption: Patrick J. Foye at the headquarters for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in Manhattan last year. He has resigned his job as the executive director.

summaries.body: Patrick J. Foye had said he would resign after he was not named chief executive of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. Now he says he will stay until the post is filled.
After announcing last fall that it would release "Back to the Future"-esque footwear, Nike revealed its self-lacing shoes this week.

display_asset.caption: Martin Shkreli testified by video before a hearing of the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee in February.

summaries.body: A lawyer for Turing Pharmaceuticals told a Senate panel that he had warned against increasing the price on a decades-old drug.

display_asset.caption: Passengers at a BART station’s platform in San Francisco last year.

summaries.body: A spokesman for Bay Area Rapid Transit used Twitter to openly describe the system's struggles, responding candidly to users' complaints about delays.

An elephant named Morgan briefly crossed from Kenya into Somalia, and researchers said his survival suggested that a small population still exists in the war-torn nation, where elephants were thought to have been wiped out.

display_asset.caption: Officer Ken Johnson
display_asset.credit: Farmers Branch Police Department, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Texas police officer, Ken Johnson, was charged with murder after chasing down and fatally shooting one of two teenagers he suspected of trying to break into his car.
New York City's St. Patrick’s Day Parade included two firsts: the participation of an openly gay Irish group, and the presence of Mayor Bill de Blasio.

display_asset.caption: Dennis Dunn stood in what he said was his usual spot on Fifth Avenue at the Saint Patrick’s Day Parade in Manhattan in 2015.

summaries.body: Corned beef and cabbage? Not so Irish, historians say. The dish is a staple of St. Patrick’s Day, but it may have originated in the United States.
